You are at your most effective when you’ve got someone to back up your act, and you can provide ample support in return. You can augment your Assist action in the following ways:

  • When you take the Assist action, you can make a single weapon attack as a minor action. If you Commit to the Bit, you can choose to delay this attack until you are within range of a target on the assisted creature’s turn.
  • When you take the Assist action, you can use your minor action to cast a cantrip with a normal casting time of one action. If you Commit to the Bit, you can instead use your minor action to cast a 1st level spell with a normal casting time of one action. A 1st level spell cast in this way can only affect you, the assisted creature, and objects carried by either of you.
